body: Concept ACK
utACK 7b5c0e0

It may be helpful if the text includes "... only... net..." to match the arg name `onlynet`. So how about this tweak?
> Actively connect to remote nodes <del>exclusively in</del><ins>only through</ins> network....

I think You could have a point here.
How about "only in network..." like it was before?
>Actively connect to remote nodes ~~exclusively~~only in network....

Allthough "exclusively" sounds more precise to me. Maybe English native speaker(I am not) could comment.

To me (a native English speaker), "connect... only through" is quite natural and unambiguously describes the network route, as opposed to the unintended alternative interpretation that "exclusively in" conveys where the user may expect the remote node to be isolated in a single network.

Thanks for Your explanation. I will try to clone my github fork repo to local computer to rebase and squash the current and (Your suggested) followup commit, as described in [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
Commited change suggested by rodasmith, rebased and squashed.
ACK 7de76d0336da8b7c01f7e3ec771c4b7ceec531d9
utACK 7de76d0336da8b7c01f7e3ec771c4b7ceec531d9
Please only mention `onion` here, `tor` is deprecated (and only supported for backwards compatbility).
OK, removed mentioning of "tor" and added a comment in the sourcecode, respectively.

The mention of active and passive here is redundant, and sounds confusing to me (it sounds like they're referring to an additional property of connections beyond incoming/outgoing, but I believe you just mean them to be synonyms with those).

> The mention of active and passive here is redundant, and sounds confusing to me

You mean
_Connect to remote nodes only through network <net> (ipv4, ipv6 or onion). Incoming connections are not affected by this option._
would be better? I am OK with that. I am open for any detailed wording variants, when only the core message is there. Suggestions welcome.
Sounds good to me. Or even "Only make outgoing connections through the specified network(s) (ipv4, ipv6, or onion). Incoming connections are not affected by this option."

I would be thankful for advice about a good decision finding process for finding the right words. E.g. changing the commit but therefore make previos ACKs obsolet, or post several variants and make a "poll", waiting for thumbs up/down?

> Only make outgoing connections through the specified network(s) (ipv4, ipv6, or onion).

The "(s)" would not be precise, since one can specify only exactly one network with this option, but one can put this option multiple times (with different values) in the config file.
That the network is specified, is obviously, IMHO. If it would not be specified, the option would not make sense.
I think, the mention of `<net>` should not be dropped, as it refers to the syntax definition.

What about
`Make outgoing connections only through the specified network <net> (ipv4, ipv6, or onion). Incoming connections are not affected by this option. This option can be specified multiple times.`
Adjusted the documentation text.

utACK ec318b3270be89214ad368140340d8ff5fa8b9f0 modulo squash into one commit

The new text is much better!
Typo fix (comma) and squashed.
OK^^
utACK 2454a85.
